projects.title: Virtual Mouse using OpenCV
projects.description: A computer vision project that allows controlling the mouse cursor using hand gestures detected by a webcam.
projects.longDescription: This project utilizes OpenCV and Python to create a virtual mouse system controlled by hand gestures. The application tracks hand movements using a webcam and translates them into mouse cursor movements on screen. It includes gesture recognition for click, scroll, and drag operations.
features: Mouse cursor control with hand movements
Click, scroll, and drag gesture recognition

technicalDetails.description: This system uses a combination of computer vision techniques for precise hand tracking and gesture recognition.
technicalDetails.architecture: The application uses MediaPipe for hand landmark detection and OpenCV for image processing. Hand landmarks are mapped to screen coordinates using a custom calibration system.

challenges.challenge: Achieving stable cursor movement with natural hand tremors
challenges.solution: Implemented adaptive smoothing algorithms and movement thresholds to filter out micro-movements.

challenges.challenge: Distinguishing between intentional gestures and passive hand movements
challenges.solution: Created a state machine approach for gesture recognition with temporal analysis to confirm intentional gestures.

projects.title: AI-Based Tic-Tac-Toe Game
projects.description: An unbeatable Tic-Tac-Toe AI opponent using the Minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning.
projects.longDescription: This implementation features an AI opponent that uses the Minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to make optimal moves in the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game. The AI analyzes all possible game states to determine the best move, making it effectively unbeatable.

technicalDetails.description: This implementation demonstrates fundamental AI concepts through game theory application.
technicalDetails.architecture: The game uses a tree-based search algorithm to evaluate all possible future game states and select optimal moves.

challenges.challenge: Optimizing the algorithm for better performance
challenges.solution: Implemented alpha-beta pruning to reduce the number of nodes evaluated by the minimax algorithm.
Added a randomized decision factor at specific depths to make the AI occasionally choose suboptimal moves for easier difficulty settings.

projects.title: IRIS Dataset Entropy Calculation
projects.description: A data science project that calculates entropy and information gain for the classic IRIS dataset.
projects.longDescription: This project implements decision tree algorithms from scratch to calculate entropy and information gain for the classic IRIS dataset. It demonstrates core concepts in data mining and machine learning by showing how information theory can be used for feature selection and classification.
features: Information gain computation for feature selection

technicalDetails.description: This project demonstrates foundational concepts in information theory as applied to machine learning.
technicalDetails.architecture: The implementation uses numpy for numerical computations and matplotlib for visualizing entropy distribution across features.

challenges.challenge: Handling continuous variables in entropy calculations
challenges.solution: Implemented dynamic binning strategies to discretize continuous variables while preserving information content.

projects.title: 3D Solar System Scene using OpenGL
projects.description: An interactive 3D simulation of the solar system with realistic planet movements using OpenGL.
projects.longDescription: This project creates a visually stunning and physically accurate representation of our solar system using OpenGL. Planets orbit the sun following accurate orbital periods and rotations, with realistic texturing and lighting effects.

technicalDetails.description: This project demonstrates 3D graphics programming and physics simulation techniques.
technicalDetails.architecture: The application uses modern OpenGL with custom shaders for realistic planet rendering, with a physics engine for orbital calculations.

challenges.challenge: Maintaining accurate scale while keeping visualization useful
challenges.solution: Implemented a dynamic scaling system that preserves relative planet sizes while adjusting distances for better visualization.

challenges.challenge: Optimizing rendering for multiple detailed planet models
challenges.solution: Created level-of-detail systems and texture streaming to maintain high performance even with detailed planet models.

projects.title: Internet Speed Calculator
projects.description: A tool for measuring and analyzing internet connection speed with historical tracking.
projects.longDescription: This application provides accurate measurements of download and upload speeds, ping, and jitter. It stores historical data to track performance over time and identify patterns in connection quality.
features: Accurate download and upload speed measurement

technicalDetails.description: This tool uses multiple connection testing methodologies to provide accurate speed measurements.
technicalDetails.architecture: The application establishes multiple concurrent connections to testing servers for bandwidth measurement while monitoring round-trip time for latency calculations.

challenges.challenge: Ensuring accuracy across different network conditions
challenges.solution: Implemented adaptive testing algorithms that adjust packet sizes and testing intervals based on current network conditions.

projects.title: Canon War Game in Assembly
projects.description: A retro-style war game implemented entirely in x86 Assembly language.
projects.longDescription: This project demonstrates low-level programming principles by implementing a complete game in Assembly language. Players control canons to destroy enemy targets while managing ammunition and avoiding counter-attacks.

technicalDetails.description: This project showcases advanced assembly programming techniques for game development.
technicalDetails.architecture: The game uses direct memory manipulation for graphics and custom interrupt handlers for input processing.

challenges.solution: Created a double-buffering system and optimized drawing routines to maintain consistent frame rates.

challenges.challenge: Managing game state without high-level constructs
challenges.solution: Designed a memory-efficient state management system using fixed-offset memory blocks and bit manipulation.

projects.title: Bubble Pop Screen Saver & Game
projects.description: A dual-purpose application functioning as both a relaxing screensaver and an interactive bubble-popping game.
projects.longDescription: This project combines a visually appealing bubble animation screensaver with interactive gameplay. In screensaver mode, colorful bubbles float and interact with realistic physics, while game mode challenges players to pop bubbles for points within time constraints.
features: Realistic bubble physics with collision detection

technicalDetails.description: This application demonstrates graphics programming and physics simulation techniques.
technicalDetails.architecture: The program uses a unified core engine for both modes, with state transitions handling the switch between passive animation and interactive gameplay.

challenges.solution: Implemented a custom physics engine with surface tension simulation and realistic collision responses.

projects.title: Analog Clock
projects.description: A realistic analog clock implementation with smooth animation and customizable themes.
projects.longDescription: This project creates a visually accurate analog clock with smooth second, minute, and hour hand movements. It features multiple themes, a customizable interface, and accurate timekeeping synchronized with system time.

technicalDetails.description: This project demonstrates animation techniques and time manipulation in web development.
technicalDetails.architecture: The clock uses HTML Canvas for rendering, with JavaScript handling time calculations and animation frames.

challenges.solution: Implemented continuous rotation calculations rather than discrete second updates, providing a more natural movement effect.

projects.title: Unix Command Utilities
projects.description: Implementation of Unix command pipelines with ls, sort, and wc commands using child processes.
projects.longDescription: This project demonstrates inter-process communication by implementing core Unix commands (ls, sort, and wc) that can be piped together. It showcases low-level process management, file descriptors, and signal handling.
features: Implementation of ls, sort, and wc commands

technicalDetails.description: This project demonstrates systems programming concepts and process management techniques.
technicalDetails.architecture: The implementation uses fork() and exec() for process creation, with pipes for inter-process communication.

challenges.challenge: Managing file descriptors across process boundaries
challenges.solution: Implemented a descriptor tracking system to ensure proper duplication and closing of file handles during process creation.
Created a parser and execution engine that can handle variable-length command chains with proper resource cleanup.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: A modern, animated portfolio website showcasing my projects and skills using React and GSAP.
projects.longDescription: This portfolio website features modern design principles with interactive animations, responsive layouts, and dynamic content. It showcases projects, skills, and professional experience with a focus on performance and user experience.

technicalDetails.description: This website demonstrates modern frontend development practices and animation techniques.
technicalDetails.architecture: The site uses React for component-based structure, with GSAP for animations and Mantine UI for consistent styling.

challenges.solution: Implemented a custom animation system with GSAP timelines for coordinated entrance and exit animations.
Used animation batching, requestAnimationFrame timing, and progressive enhancement to maintain smooth performance across devices.
